edu.wpi.cs.wpisuitetng.modules

Interface EntityManager<T extends Model>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Model Class
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEntityManager, CommentManager, DeckEntityManager, DefectManager, IterationEntityManager, MockUserManager, PlanningPokerEntityManager, PlanningPokerFinalEstimateEntityManager, PlanningPokerUserEntityManager, PlanningPokerVoteEntityManager, PostBoardEntityManager, ProjectManager, RequirementEntityManager, UserManager

    public interface EntityManager<T extends Model>
    Interface for all EntityManagers. Enforces standards for interaction with the Model class T.
    Author:
    twack, mpdelladonna

      • advancedPut

        java.lang.String advancedPut(Session s,
                           java.lang.String[] args,
                           java.lang.String content)
                             throws WPISuiteException
        ************** A note about the content body. Must not contain any line breaks. Only the first line is passed to this function. ************** This method is accessed through the API by a PUT request to the AdvancedAPI
        Parameters:
        s - The session that requested this action
        args[] - A String array containing the entire path of the PUT that initiated this action
        content - The content body of the request
        Throws:
        WPISuiteException

      • advancedPost

        java.lang.String advancedPost(Session s,
                            java.lang.String string,
                            java.lang.String content)
                              throws WPISuiteException
        ********************** A note about advanced post. the content body should not contain any line breaks. only the first line will be passed through to the function. ********************** This method is similar to the Advanced Put method, except that where ADvanced Put recieves the entire path as a String array, Advanced Post only receives the third path argument, for example API/advanced/module/model/argument The reasoning behind this was to allow module developers who required more methods a way to multiplex this one call into multiple different functions. By using the argument as a key in a switch statement or if else block, they can process the content payload through an unlimited number of functions.
        Parameters:
        s - - The session that requested this action
        string - - A path identifier [/module/model/identifier]
        content - - The String payload of the request
        Returns:
        - a String to be sent back as the body of the request
        Throws:
        WPISuiteException
